availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Marion Cartright Taylor (Shelby County, Ky, attorney; capt & colonel 15th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Ohio County, Kentucky, native. Attended St. Mary's College. Graduate of University of Louisville Law School in 1849. Attorney in Shelby County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Shelby County in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain and colonel from December 14, 1861, to January 14, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby, District 1, p. 296B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby, District 2, p. 3.
Find A Grave, "Col Marion Cartright Taylor (1822-1871)," Memorial #7430426, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7430426 (accessed June 22, 2017).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 892.
Roger D. Hunt, Colonels in Blue -- Indiana, Kentucky and Tennessee: A Civil War Biographical Dictionary (Jefferson, NC: McFarland & Company, Inc., Publishers, 2014), 189.
